title: Jada Pinkett Smith 'in negotiations' to return for The Matrix 4
text:
Hot on the heels of news that Neil Patrick Harris is joining the cast of the fourth Matrix movie, it's being reported that Jada Pinkett Smith might also be joining the production.

The actress, 48, played the character of Niobi in The Matrix: Reloaded and The Matrix: Revolutions, both released in 2003.

Deadline.com reported Tuesday that the wife of Hollywood star Will Smith is 'in negotiations' and no decision has yet been made about her return.

Talks: Jada Pinkett Smith, 48, is reported to be 'in negotiations' to join the cast of the fourth film in The Matrix series currently in development at Warner Bros.

The original stars of 1999's The Matrix - Keanu Reeves as Neo and Carrie-Ann Moss as Trinity - are both on board with Lana Wachowski at the helm.

Also set to star in the sci-fi action film is Yahya Abdul-Mateen II who is believed to be portraying a younger version of Morpheus, played in the original films by Laurence Fishburne.

The three Matrix movies, written, directed and produced by Lana and sister Lilly, took in more than $1.6 billion at the global box office.

Landmark films: The actress played the character of Niobi in The Matrix: Reloaded, left, and The Matrix: Revolutions, right, both released in 2003

Back for more: The original stars of 1999's The Matrix - Keanu Reeves as Neo and Carrie-Ann Moss as Trinity - are both on board for the fourth film with Lana Wachowski at the helm

No details have been made public about the plot for The Matrix 4 which was announced by Warner Bros. in August.

Warner Bros. Picture Group chairman Toby Emmerich said in a statement at the time: 'We could not be more excited to be re-entering The Matrix with Lana.'

'Lana is a true visionary — a singular and original creative filmmaker — and we are thrilled that she is writing, directing and producing this new chapter in The Matrix universe.'

Cast: Also Tuesday, it was revealed that Neil Patrick Harris, pictured last month, is on board the sci-fi action film. He joins another newcomer Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, right pictured in late 2018
